definition: to send out/to show (one's feeling)/to issue/to develop/to make a bundle of money/classifier for gunshots (rounds)
perspiration/sweat/CL:滴[di1],頭|头[tou2],身[shen1]/to be speechless (out of helplessness, embarrassment etc) (Internet slang used as an interjection)
see 可汗[ke4 han2], 汗國|汗国[han2 guo2]

sentences.english: Visible all sweating evil spirits are not sweat, wet disease in particular.
sentences.chinese: 可见凡发汗祛邪都不可使其大汗，湿病尤其如此。

sentences.english: Anti-drying, to wrinkles, promote diaphoretic to prevent obstruction skin, and assist detoxification.
sentences.chinese: 防干燥，去皱纹，促进发汗，防止阻塞皮肤，助排毒。

sentences.english: To master insensible evaporation and sweating.
This state was accompanied by heavy sweating.
sentences.chinese: 这种状态伴随着巨大的发汗。

sentences.english: You have a fever? You better get in bed and sweat it out.
sentences.chinese: 你发烧了？你最好上床去发一发汗。

sentences.english: In this paper, we discuss the free boundary-value problem resulting from the water transpiration temperature field control model.
sentences.chinese: 本文研究水发汗温度场控制模型导出的自由边界问题。

sentences.english: Everyday, we sit in the steam room trying to sweat off some fat.
sentences.chinese: 每天，我们坐在蒸汽室里试图通过发汗减去一些脂肪。

sentences.english: I could not tell whether he was sweating from heat or from fear.
sentences.chinese: 我说不清他到底是在发汗还是太热或是恐惧。

sentences.english: Your heart is beating, your palms are sweating, you're breathing harder.
sentences.chinese: 你的心砰砰直跳，手心发汗，呼吸变得困难。

sentences.english: The sweat effects were studied by the way of affecting sweat secretion of the rats' paw.
sentences.chinese: 通过对大鼠足跖汗液分泌的影响观察其发汗解表作用。

sentences.english: The transpiration control problem is investigated with water as the coolant.
sentences.chinese: 本文采用水作为发汗剂研究了发汗控制问题。

sentences.english: The transpiration control problem is investigated with water as the coolant.
sentences.chinese: 本文采用水作为发汗剂研究了发汗控制问题。

sentences.english: This paper considers the solution and its properties of the transpiration ablation problem.
sentences.chinese: 本文研究发汗烧蚀控制问题的解及其解的性质。

definition: to warm oneself/to expel the cold (TCM)
superficial syndrome/illness that has not attacked the vital organs of the human body
to relieve (cold, rheumatic pain etc)/lit. to dispel pathogenic wind (TCM)
to alleviate fever (medicine)/to clear internal heat (Chinese medicine)
pathogeny (cause of disease) in TCM/as opposed to vital energy 正氣|正气[zheng4 qi4]
